14#ifndef ISC_COUNTER_H
15#define ISC_COUNTER_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file isc/counter.h
22 *
23 * \brief The isc_counter_t object is a simplified version of the
24 * isc_quota_t object; it tracks the consumption of limited
25 * resources, returning an error condition when the quota is
26 * exceeded. However, unlike isc_quota_t, attaching and detaching
27 * from a counter object does not increment or decrement the counter.
28 */
29
30/***
31 *** Imports.
32 ***/
33
34#include <isc/lang.h>
35#include <isc/mutex.h>
36#include <isc/types.h>
37
38/*****
39 ***** Types.
40 *****/
41
42ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
43
44isc_result_t
45isc_counter_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, int limit, isc_counter_t **counterp);
46/*%<
47 * Allocate and initialize a counter object.
48 */
49
50isc_result_t
51isc_counter_increment(isc_counter_t *counter);
52/*%<
53 * Increment the counter.
54 *
55 * If the counter limit is nonzero and has been reached, then
56 * return ISC_R_QUOTA, otherwise ISC_R_SUCCESS. (The counter is
57 * incremented regardless of return value.)
58 */
59
60unsigned int
61isc_counter_used(isc_counter_t *counter);
62/*%<
63 * Return the current counter value.
64 */
65
66void
67isc_counter_setlimit(isc_counter_t *counter, int limit);
68/*%<
69 * Set the counter limit.
70 */
71
72void
73isc_counter_attach(isc_counter_t *source, isc_counter_t **targetp);
74/*%<
75 * Attach to a counter object, increasing its reference counter.
76 */
77
78void
79isc_counter_detach(isc_counter_t **counterp);
80/*%<
81 * Detach (and destroy if reference counter has dropped to zero)
82 * a counter object.
83 */
84
85ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
86
87#endif /* ISC_COUNTER_H */
88
